title: Excludes from sales tax receipts the rental or leasing of trucks and other motor vehicles used in connection with the production of a film for sale
summary: Excludes from sales tax receipts the rental or leasing of trucks and other motor vehicles used in connection with the production of a film for sale.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3976

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 31, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. MORELLE -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Ways and Means

       AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to  excluding  from  sales  tax
         receipts the rental or leasing of trucks and other motor vehicles used
         in connection with the production of a film for sale

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision (a) of section 1115 of the tax law  is  amended
    2  by adding a new paragraph 44 to read as follows:
    3    (44)  THE  RENTAL OR LEASE OF TRUCKS, TRACTORS, TRAILERS OR SEMITRAIL-
    4  ERS, AS SUCH TERMS ARE DEFINED IN ARTICLE ONE OF THE VEHICLE AND TRAFFIC
    5  LAW, PROVIDED SUCH VEHICLE IS USED IN CONNECTION WITH THE PRODUCTION  OF
    6  A  FILM  FOR  SALE.  THE FOREGOING SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO,
    7  SUCH VEHICLES THAT ARE USED AS DRESSING ROOMS, WARDROBE TRUCKS, HAIR AND
    8  MAKEUP TRUCKS, HONEYWAGONS, PRODUCTION OFFICE TRAILERS, AND  CAMERA  AND
    9  EQUIPMENT  TRUCKS. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS PARAGRAPH, THE TERM "FILM" MEANS
   10  FEATURE FILMS, DOCUMENTARY FILMS, SHORTS, TELEVISION  FILMS,  TELEVISION
   11  COMMERCIALS AND SIMILAR PRODUCTION.
   12    S  2.  This act shall take effect immediately; provided, however, that
   13  the provisions of this act shall first be implemented on the  first  day
   14  of a sales tax quarterly period, as such period is described in subdivi-
   15  sion  (b)  of section 1136 of the tax law, beginning at least sixty days
   16  after the date this act shall have become  a  law  and  shall  apply  to
   17  services rendered and sales made on or after that date although rendered
   18  or made under a prior contract.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05384-01-1
